paragraphs.body: Vaz, I was thinking that we should boost up the standards for gaining both a certificate and the Star Editor title.  What I did was truly nothing.  I did some grammatical correction and a little expansion.  Yet, I recieve a certificate and am nearing the title of Star Editor.  I think that we should make the users work for the title.  I feel that if we make them really work to earn the title, it would become far more prestigious.  This is what I was thinking.  In order to earn a certificate, a user must have put forth at least twenty constructive edits to the article.  That way, when they have earned five certificates and the "Star Editor" title, they would have had to have put forth at least 100 edits on just these articles.  What do you think? Mattkenn3 Talk 15:18, 2 May 2009 (UTC)

paragraphs.body: Hello, I would like to apply for a position as a deputy editor for the BSST. As is known, I am a rather active member of the wiki community and am always up-to-date with the events of the wiki community. The BSST has fallen into inactivity, but as my contributions log will show, I am an active member of numerous edits of good quantity. I also have ideas for how to increase interest in contributing to the BSST, such as a debating column, where users can debate a set topic (for example, Korrasami v. Makorra or Air v. Fire) in a public sandbox before it is added to the BSST; and a simple list of recent fanons, rather than full descriptions; a community story, in which someone writes one sentence first (Avatar related) and members can write a sentence to continue the plot. I would be more than happy to oversee these columns. There are a few other, minor suggestions.
